Posts.Content: [quote="rose8"]i have not been on for a while its a year since i finished all my treatments i occasionally have pain in the breast i had op on is this normal im Hi Rose, My name is ellen and, it has been two year's since I finished my rad following my lumpectomy, and I still have tedernes also. I think it's just something I'll have to live with. And that's the key word. LIVE. I was told that the breast tissue is very sensitive so I think it's normal, but mention it to yor Dr.anyway. Ellen
Posts.Title: is the pain normal

Posts.Content: Hi, I was DX 2 years ago with BC, mucinous carcinoma. stage 1 had radiation, lump ec. and on tamoxafin for 5 years. I'm now 52. I know the cancer I had is kind of rare, I would love to hear from anyone else with this form of breast cancer. I'm doing well but, live in fear of it coming back, or spreading. I'm trying not to let it take over my life, but it's hard sometimes. I would love to hear from anyone! thanks, Ellen
Posts.Title: mucinous carcinoma of the breast

Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm wondering if anyone else still has numbness and tenderness 2 years after lumpectomy. Is it just something that I have to learn to live with? I go for my second yearly mamo tomorrow and am a little freaked out. I had a 1.2 greatest dimention,mucinous carcinoma invasive compoent size 0.7 no lymph node involvment er and pr very pos. HER2 - I had 35 rounds of rads. and am now on tamoxifen. I'm 52 and found my lump myself, two years ago. I don't know anyone else with this type of BC. I know that I am lucky that I found my BC early, and that so many others have had a much harder time then me but, I still live in fear. I am really working on trying to enjoy life and stop worrying so much. What sence does it make to LIVE with the fear of dying? Does it ever get easier? Anyway, thanks for letting me sound off. I would love to hear from anyone. Thank you Jim for your email. You are in my thoughts and prayers too Ellen from NC.
Posts.Title: still have numbness and tenterness

Posts.Content: Hi, So sorry about your Mom's dx. But sounds like they cought it early. I don't know what type of BC she has. Mine was a mucinous carcinoma, somewhat rare it seems, I was dx two years ago and I'm doing great. I know the fear you and your family must be feeling. Make sure you ask for copies of all her path. reports. I only had a little swelling after my lymph nodes were removed. But I felt more pain in my underarm then my breast after my lumpectomy, so she will be sore. Please keep us posted on her condition. I wil keep you and your Mom in my thoughts and prayers. Ellen
Posts.Title: Infiltrating Lobular Carcinoma

Posts.Content: Hi my name is ellen and I'm new here, I just want to say how happy I an for you and Maria! COngrats!!!
Posts.Title: MyMaria is cancer free!
